intro: Coccocypselum repens, commonly known as the creeping coccocypselum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its prostrate growth habit, with numerous small, yellowish-white flowers clustered along the stems. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. The plant is adapted to thrive in moist, shaded environments and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
